intro: Banara ibaguensis, commonly known as the Ibaguense banara, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Banara ibaguensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
